simulated_ratings.title: Cook the Thief His Wife & Her Lover, The (1989)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Gorgeously formal and cruel—its artifice seduces even as it repels.

simulated_ratings.title: Naked (1993)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Bracingly raw, but its misanthropy bludgeons more than it probes.

simulated_ratings.title: Samsara (2011)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Immaculate surfaces, thin aftertaste—stunning but spiritually generic.

simulated_ratings.title: Passion of Anna, The (Passion, En) (1969)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Austere turmoil I admire more than I feel.

simulated_ratings.title: Baraka (1992)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Hypnotic rhythms and craft, yet a touch museum-like.

simulated_ratings.feeling: Glass propels the image-symphony

simulated_ratings.feeling: Grotesque hospital trance—uneven, oddly compelling.

simulated_ratings.feeling: Graceful carousel of desire, charming if slight for me.

simulated_ratings.feeling: Lush, aching metaphysics that lingers like a melody.

simulated_ratings.feeling: Bunuel’s barbed games amuse, if at an analytic distance.

simulated_ratings.title: Time Machine, The (1960)

simulated_ratings.feeling: Simian shtick and sports uplift—manufactured idiocy with a headache aftertaste.

simulated_ratings.feeling: Mechanical bumps and baby-in-peril escalation—efficient, numbing.

simulated_ratings.title: Blades of Glory (2007)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Loud spoof energy, little shape—jokes skate in circles.

simulated_ratings.feeling: Shrill rom-com psychosis—concept stretched to grating.

simulated_ratings.title: She's the Man (2006)
